page.title: 04Linton-on-Ouse.
page.content: Linton-on-Ouse is a linear village between Newton-on-Ouse and Aldwark Toll Bridge,crossing the River Ouse.Roads lead off to R.A.F. Linton-on-Ouse and housing estates for R.A.F. personnel.There are houses on both sides of the main street,but there are no outstanding features.The village lies on the edge of the old Royal Forest of Galtres."Lin" of Linton may mean"by the water" or derived from"line"or flax once grown in this area. In the early Middle Ages Linton was a baronial fief of the Roos family and sold in 1618 to the Appleby family of Teesdale,devout Roman Catholics.In 1706 the Manor was bought by Dr.John Radcliffe.On his death in 1714 the Manor of Linton-on-Ouse was bequeathed to University College,Oxford,which still owns property in the area.
